description.narrative: The objective of the project is to reduce the energy consumption and related GHG emissions with the focus on new residential buildings.
seat of a first-order administrative division

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Demonstrated energy and costsaving potential of new energy efficiency measures in at least three new residential buildings in two Belarusian cities

comment.narrative: NA

Each of the 3 demonstration buildings constructed and reaching the target for annual external energy demand for space heating and hot water equal or less than 60 kWhm2 and their energy consumption and other performance living comfort etc monitored for at least one full year Full completion of this outcome without project extension is moderately unlikely because of oneyear delay of the project start If the documented disseminated and institutionalized project results should be based on the results of the three buildings being built then completion of this Outcome without project extension is unlikely
The baseline costs of the 3 demo buildings is covered in full by the projects cofinancing resources and the GEF financing for incremental EE measures will not exceed 15 of the total construction costs of each demo building

None of the three demonstration buildings has been constructed and monitored yet
Background studies preconstruction simulations and exploratory designs of measures technological methods installations and equipment for energy efficiency improvement of three pilot buildings and design of all three selected pilot buildings have been completed along with application of integrated building design principles and taking into account new technologies and approaches suggested and formulated by the project
The design and construction documentations of all three pilot buildings in Hrodna Mahiliou and Minsk have been developed and submitted to the state expertise for approval The construction documentation of the pilot building in Hrodna has been approved Such approval for construction documentations of other two buildings is expected in July 2015
The project has already procured of about 15 of all equipment accessories and tools and started procurement procedures for the rest
In line with the commitments assumed in writing by the project partners they have covered the baseline cost of design and construction documentations for all three pilot buildings Recently the GrodnoGrazhdanProject informed the PIU that they will not be able to provide further sustainable financing of the pilot house in Grodno The PIU and UNDP CO have in cooperation with the Head of EE Department approached the Grodno authorities to settle this issue As a result another builder is ready to take over the initiative and commit itself to provide necessary financing of the construction in Grodno The project is currently waiting for a formal letter The two other partners reconfirmed in writing their financial commitments to support the baseline construction proven by corresponding Oblast authorities and submitted timeframes for design and construction of pilot buildings in Minsk and Mogilev
According to the design and construction documentations the energy performance of these buildings will be in line with the outcome target which stipulates for annual external energy demand for space heating and hot water supply to be equal or less than 60 kWhm2 and the cost of incremental energy efficiency measures will not exceed 15 of the total construction costs

Each of the 3 demonstration buildings constructed and reaching the target for annual external energy demand for space heating and hot water equal or less than 60 kWhm2 and their energy consumption and other performance living comfort etc monitored for at least one full year Full completion of this outcome without project extension is moderately unlikely because of oneyear delay of the project start If the documented disseminated and institutionalized project results should be based on the results of the three buildings being built then completion of this Outcome without project extension is unlikely
The baseline costs of the 3 demo buildings is covered in full by the projects cofinancing resources and the GEF financing for incremental EE measures will not exceed 15 of the total construction costs of each demo building

None of the three demonstration buildings has been constructed and monitored yet
Background studies preconstruction simulations and exploratory designs of measures technological methods installations and equipment for energy efficiency improvement of three pilot buildings and design of all three selected pilot buildings have been completed along with application of integrated building design principles and taking into account new technologies and approaches suggested and formulated by the project
The design and construction documentations of all three pilot buildings in Hrodna Mahiliou and Minsk have been developed and submitted to the state expertise for approval The construction documentation of the pilot building in Hrodna has been approved Such approval for construction documentations of other two buildings is expected in July 2015
The project has already procured of about 15 of all equipment accessories and tools and started procurement procedures for the rest
In line with the commitments assumed in writing by the project partners they have covered the baseline cost of design and construction documentations for all three pilot buildings Recently the GrodnoGrazhdanProject informed the PIU that they will not be able to provide further sustainable financing of the pilot house in Grodno The PIU and UNDP CO have in cooperation with the Head of EE Department approached the Grodno authorities to settle this issue As a result another builder is ready to take over the initiative and commit itself to provide necessary financing of the construction in Grodno The project is currently waiting for a formal letter The two other partners reconfirmed in writing their financial commitments to support the baseline construction proven by corresponding Oblast authorities and submitted timeframes for design and construction of pilot buildings in Minsk and Mogilev
According to the design and construction documentations the energy performance of these buildings will be in line with the outcome target which stipulates for annual external energy demand for space heating and hot water supply to be equal or less than 60 kWhm2 and the cost of incremental energy efficiency measures will not exceed 15 of the total construction costs

description.narrative: Documented disseminated and institutionalized project results providing a basis for further replication

Status of the planned public outreach activities
Status of the entity to follow up and continue the activities initiated by the project
Number of visit and downloads from the project website

comment.narrative: NA

Planned public outreach activities successfully completed
An entity to follow up and as applicable to continue the activities initiated by the project has been designated with adequate resources to perform its work
At least 100 hits and 20 downloaded documents per month from the project website by outside visitors

Public outreach activities being successfully implemented
14 communication campaigns 5 international conferences 5 round tables 2 international seminars abroad one pressconference 6 training workshops one Earth Day Event one 3DPicture Event two exhibitions
39 pressreleases and 67 articles published in webbased media
148 technical reports and 16 brochures printed or published in webbased media
40 news pieces broadcasted The partnership network includes more than 25 media resources
Support has been provided for 20122013 and 20132014 Energy Marathon Republican Contest The PMU was taking part in the Contest Committee The Contest materials have been prepared published and disseminated in 500 CDs among schools relevant Universities and the Ministry of Education
No state agency with a responsibility to monitor the energy savings and CO2 emission reductions in residential buildings has been mandated and capacitated yet This activity was initially planned for 20152016
In average per month 190 hits and 1700 documents are being downloaded by outside visitors
The project website test version was created as of 01122013 The fully operated version was launched on 19122013 The website is being regularly updated wwweffbuildby

description.narrative: Enhanced capacity of the Belarusian specialists to implement and effectively enforce new energy efficiency standards and construction norms with the initial focus on new residential buildings
Demonstrated capacity of the Belarussian building sector specialist to integrate new EE approaches and measures into the design of the buildings and to implement them in practice

comment.narrative:
Nonintegrated design of the buildings just complying with the current prescriptive thermal standards in force
Lack of capacity of the public authorities to effectively supervise and enforce the implementation of the planned new overall energy performance based norms and standards

Integrated energy efficient building design approach together with buildings overall energy performance based design principles adopted into the work of at least 30 of all local design institutes as well as into the curricula of all educational institutes in Belarus educating new architects and building construction and HVAC engineers
By the end of the project at least 50 experts from each key professional group see outputs 2226 and 200 university students have taken and successfully passed courses on energy efficient building design and constructionKey public authorities responsible for supervision and enforcement of the planned new norms and regulations trained

6
There are already 7 local design institutes ie NIPTIS MAPID Hrodnagrazhdanproekt Gomelgrazhdanproekt SaintGobain Construction Product BelRus Tenth UNR Minskproekt out of ca 120 design institutes operating in the field of civil construction engineering which are introducing in their practice design and construction of residential buildings with energy efficiency improvement components developed and advocated by the project
The project developed and disseminated about 40 special technical reports and guidelines on energy efficiency design principles The recommendations with cost efficiency analysis of different technical options applicable to the development of energy efficient residential buildings were prepared and discussed with stakeholders The recommendations are intended to be tested during the development of pilot buildings and will be included in national technical regulations and standards
More than 70 specialists
The analysis of target groups along with assessment of needs in their capacity building has been conducted and the capacity building action plan for 20142016 has been compiled discussed with Energy Efficiency Department and other stakeholders and approved Training textbooks have been drafted and disseminated
More than 70 specialists has developed their skills and increased knowledge for leading and managing effective energy audit in residential houses during three twoday training courses organized in Sep Oct and December 2014 One training course was conducted during actual energy audit measurements onsite
More than 70 specialists has taken and passed sixday training courses held in Hrodna and Minsk on energy efficient building design and construction new energy efficiency improvement policy norms and standards The trainings were attended by 29 companies designers engineers builders construction inspectors utilities representatives etc
The project provided support and organized logistics for 9 study visits and 10 international events abroad where about 30 decisionmakers designers builders and other relevant specialists have become acquainted with design construction and operation practices as well as with legal framework standards and policies exercised in four leading European countries Germany Austria England and France in the field of energy efficient residential buildings
No syllabus related to energy efficient building design principles has been adopted into the curricula of target educational institutes in Belarus yet No student has passed the courses yet
The critical analysis of curricula of different relevant universities has been conducted and the proposals for its improvement and updating have been presented in a project report along with a list of suggested university courses Based on the report recommendations for relevant university curricular updates have been drafted presented and approved at two roundtables about 60 representatives of stakeholders have participated
Three new courses related to the best international and national practice in the field of design and construction of energy efficient residential buildings were suggested and presented by the project During roundtable discussions held in the Belarusian National Technical University conjointly with Scientific Council Meeting with presence of representatives from 14 faculties of 7 universities three national universities agreed to include these new courses in their syllabi The decision has been made to continue cooperation with the said faculties in order to further adjust the curricular materials prepared by the project to current syllabi

Integrated energy efficient building design approach together with buildings overall energy performance based design principles adopted into the work of at least 30 of all local design institutes as well as into the curricula of all educational institutes in Belarus educating new architects and building construction and HVAC engineers
By the end of the project at least 50 experts from each key professional group see outputs 2226 and 200 university students have taken and successfully passed courses on energy efficient building design and constructionKey public authorities responsible for supervision and enforcement of the planned new norms and regulations trained

6
There are already 7 local design institutes ie NIPTIS MAPID Hrodnagrazhdanproekt Gomelgrazhdanproekt SaintGobain Construction Product BelRus Tenth UNR Minskproekt out of ca 120 design institutes operating in the field of civil construction engineering which are introducing in their practice design and construction of residential buildings with energy efficiency improvement components developed and advocated by the project
The project developed and disseminated about 40 special technical reports and guidelines on energy efficiency design principles The recommendations with cost efficiency analysis of different technical options applicable to the development of energy efficient residential buildings were prepared and discussed with stakeholders The recommendations are intended to be tested during the development of pilot buildings and will be included in national technical regulations and standards
More than 70 specialists
The analysis of target groups along with assessment of needs in their capacity building has been conducted and the capacity building action plan for 20142016 has been compiled discussed with Energy Efficiency Department and other stakeholders and approved Training textbooks have been drafted and disseminated
More than 70 specialists has developed their skills and increased knowledge for leading and managing effective energy audit in residential houses during three twoday training courses organized in Sep Oct and December 2014 One training course was conducted during actual energy audit measurements onsite
More than 70 specialists has taken and passed sixday training courses held in Hrodna and Minsk on energy efficient building design and construction new energy efficiency improvement policy norms and standards The trainings were attended by 29 companies designers engineers builders construction inspectors utilities representatives etc
The project provided support and organized logistics for 9 study visits and 10 international events abroad where about 30 decisionmakers designers builders and other relevant specialists have become acquainted with design construction and operation practices as well as with legal framework standards and policies exercised in four leading European countries Germany Austria England and France in the field of energy efficient residential buildings
No syllabus related to energy efficient building design principles has been adopted into the curricula of target educational institutes in Belarus yet No student has passed the courses yet
The critical analysis of curricula of different relevant universities has been conducted and the proposals for its improvement and updating have been presented in a project report along with a list of suggested university courses Based on the report recommendations for relevant university curricular updates have been drafted presented and approved at two roundtables about 60 representatives of stakeholders have participated
Three new courses related to the best international and national practice in the field of design and construction of energy efficient residential buildings were suggested and presented by the project During roundtable discussions held in the Belarusian National Technical University conjointly with Scientific Council Meeting with presence of representatives from 14 faculties of 7 universities three national universities agreed to include these new courses in their syllabi The decision has been made to continue cooperation with the said faculties in order to further adjust the curricular materials prepared by the project to current syllabi

description.narrative: Strengthened legal and regulatory framework and mechanisms to enforce the legislation for improving the energy efficiency of the building sector with the focus on new residential buildings
Status of the national laws and other regulatory documents controlling the energy consumption of the newly constructed buildings

comment.narrative: Prescriptive thermal standards adopted in 2010 defining minimum mandatory Uvalues for the building envelope corresponding to the average annual heat demand of 60 kWhm2 for space heating of typical multiapartment buildings and 120130 kWh m2 together with sanitary hot water preparation

Revised minimum energy performance standards adopted for new construction and reaching a status of a law by the end of the project with a target of reducing the energy consumption of new residential buildings for space heating and hot water together below 60 kWhm2
An energy performance certification and labelling scheme for both new and existing buildings adopted and under implementation by the end of the project

No minimum energy performance standards reaching a status of a law have been adopted yet
The project elaborated a draft of the Technical Code On Energy Efficiency of Buildings which is based on EU Directive 201031EU concerning integral energy performance of residential buildings along with the list of related national technical regulatory acts These documents were incorporated into the Plan of State Standardization for 2015 and into the State Development Program of Technical Regulation Standardization and Conformity Assessment in the Field of Energy Saving for 20112015 Both programmes were duly adopted and the project submitted the drafts of elaborated documents to the Technical Committee for Standardization in the Field of Energy Efficiency TCS14 for consideration and approval The said TCS14 was created by the Ministry of Architecture and Construction due to initiatives and support provided by the project Three project consultants were coopted to be members of TCS14 and one of them has become a chair of TCS14
As an integral part of national applications to the said Technical Code the project drafted some new standards Some of these standards have been already submitted and adopted in particular Method of calculation of specific heat consumption for heating and ventilation in residential buildings Energy performance of buildings Assessment of overall energy consumption and energy performance of buildings Energy efficiency of buildings Methods for determination of energy efficiency and energy certification buildings amendments to Thermal protection of buildings Energy performance characteristics Rules of definition
The project has prepared a draft of the methodological guidelines based on the IPMVprotocol and in line with the best international practice and with due account of national provisions for energy audit and energy performance monitoring and calculation applicable to residential buildings The draft has been verified during energy auditing of 30 multistorey residential buildings in 20132015 and adjusted accordingly It will be used for carrying out of energy audits of 25 other multistorey residential buildings in 20152016 and further enter a corresponding adoption procedure Four twoday training workshops were organized and held in 20132014 for more than 70 professional energy auditors
No energy performance certification and labeling scheme for residential buildings have been adopted yet
In technical standard Energy efficiency of buildings Methods for determination of energy efficiency and energy certification of buildings the project and its partners first introduced a scheme similar to the energy performance certification system This scheme is suggested in a building energy efficiency passport format which is to be issued as an integral part of design and construction documentations and contains all major requisites for energy performance certification Next in the second part of 2015 the project should elaborate practical procedures for the energy certification system and a system of monitoring and compliance checking applicable to residential buildings
To do this the project organized and held two roundtables for relevant stakeholders where main principles and framework of the certification system were discussed and provided further necessary consulting services to the StroyTechNorm RUE and to members of the TCS14 As of Nov 26 2014 the suggestions mentioned above were considered and approved by the said Technical Committee for further adoption procedure The project will continue its efforts in consulting the authorities using in particular such instrument as TCS14 until the said documents are duly adopted

Revised minimum energy performance standards adopted for new construction and reaching a status of a law by the end of the project with a target of reducing the energy consumption of new residential buildings for space heating and hot water together below 60 kWhm2
An energy performance certification and labelling scheme for both new and existing buildings adopted and under implementation by the end of the project

No minimum energy performance standards reaching a status of a law have been adopted yet
The project elaborated a draft of the Technical Code On Energy Efficiency of Buildings which is based on EU Directive 201031EU concerning integral energy performance of residential buildings along with the list of related national technical regulatory acts These documents were incorporated into the Plan of State Standardization for 2015 and into the State Development Program of Technical Regulation Standardization and Conformity Assessment in the Field of Energy Saving for 20112015 Both programmes were duly adopted and the project submitted the drafts of elaborated documents to the Technical Committee for Standardization in the Field of Energy Efficiency TCS14 for consideration and approval The said TCS14 was created by the Ministry of Architecture and Construction due to initiatives and support provided by the project Three project consultants were coopted to be members of TCS14 and one of them has become a chair of TCS14
As an integral part of national applications to the said Technical Code the project drafted some new standards Some of these standards have been already submitted and adopted in particular Method of calculation of specific heat consumption for heating and ventilation in residential buildings Energy performance of buildings Assessment of overall energy consumption and energy performance of buildings Energy efficiency of buildings Methods for determination of energy efficiency and energy certification buildings amendments to Thermal protection of buildings Energy performance characteristics Rules of definition
The project has prepared a draft of the methodological guidelines based on the IPMVprotocol and in line with the best international practice and with due account of national provisions for energy audit and energy performance monitoring and calculation applicable to residential buildings The draft has been verified during energy auditing of 30 multistorey residential buildings in 20132015 and adjusted accordingly It will be used for carrying out of energy audits of 25 other multistorey residential buildings in 20152016 and further enter a corresponding adoption procedure Four twoday training workshops were organized and held in 20132014 for more than 70 professional energy auditors
No energy performance certification and labeling scheme for residential buildings have been adopted yet
In technical standard Energy efficiency of buildings Methods for determination of energy efficiency and energy certification of buildings the project and its partners first introduced a scheme similar to the energy performance certification system This scheme is suggested in a building energy efficiency passport format which is to be issued as an integral part of design and construction documentations and contains all major requisites for energy performance certification Next in the second part of 2015 the project should elaborate practical procedures for the energy certification system and a system of monitoring and compliance checking applicable to residential buildings
To do this the project organized and held two roundtables for relevant stakeholders where main principles and framework of the certification system were discussed and provided further necessary consulting services to the StroyTechNorm RUE and to members of the TCS14 As of Nov 26 2014 the suggestions mentioned above were considered and approved by the said Technical Committee for further adoption procedure The project will continue its efforts in consulting the authorities using in particular such instrument as TCS14 until the said documents are duly adopted

description.narrative: To reduce the energy consumption and related GHG emissions with the focus on new residential buildings
Amount of reduced CO2 emissions compared to the projected baseline

comment.narrative: Lifetime reduction of 220000 tons of CO2eq resulting from the energy saving in buildings for which the construction has started or which have adopted into their design new energy efficiency elements that reduce the energy consumption for heating and hot water in the residential buildings below the current thermal standards in force

179 thousand tons of CO2eq
The design and construction documentations for three pilot buildings in Hrodna Mahiliou and Minsk developed by the project have been submitted for the required state expertise New energy efficiency measures have been adopted into the design of these buildings ventilation heat recuperation heat pumps on sewage and geothermal sources solar heaters and solar PVpanels The project has been already proceeded to procurement of related equipment accessories and tools These provisions allow the projected annual specific energy consumption for space heating and hot water supply to be in the range of 5060 kWhm2 that is by ca 6070 kWhm2 per year lower than in the baseline case
If this design value is proven by actual construction the lifetime 30 years GHG emission reduction will be at least 179 thousand tons of CO2eq for the three buildings in total

Lifetime reduction of 220000 tons of CO2eq resulting from the energy saving in buildings for which the construction has started or which have adopted into their design new energy efficiency elements that reduce the energy consumption for heating and hot water in the residential buildings below the current thermal standards in force

179 thousand tons of CO2eq
The design and construction documentations for three pilot buildings in Hrodna Mahiliou and Minsk developed by the project have been submitted for the required state expertise New energy efficiency measures have been adopted into the design of these buildings ventilation heat recuperation heat pumps on sewage and geothermal sources solar heaters and solar PVpanels The project has been already proceeded to procurement of related equipment accessories and tools These provisions allow the projected annual specific energy consumption for space heating and hot water supply to be in the range of 5060 kWhm2 that is by ca 6070 kWhm2 per year lower than in the baseline case
If this design value is proven by actual construction the lifetime 30 years GHG emission reduction will be at least 179 thousand tons of CO2eq for the three buildings in total

description.narrative: Number of buildings designed and constructed in accordance with the new energy efficiency standards

comment.narrative: At least 10 around 80 buildings of all new residential multistorey buildings for which the design is started during the last year of the project are integrating new EE measures into their design with the target of reducing their combined annual energy demand for space heating and hot water below 60 kWhm2

There are no buildings constructed under the auspices of the project yet
The entire design and construction documentations have been completed by the project for three pilot buildings The documentations have been submitted to the State Construction Expertise for approval In these buildings according to their design the specific annual energy consumption for space heating and hot water supply will be less than 55 kWhm2
Since 2013 12 buildings apart from 3 project pilot buildings above are being designed using principles grounded and promoted by the project In these buildings the energy consumption for space heating already reduced to ca 30 kWhm2

At least 10 around 80 buildings of all new residential multistorey buildings for which the design is started during the last year of the project are integrating new EE measures into their design with the target of reducing their combined annual energy demand for space heating and hot water below 60 kWhm2

There are no buildings constructed under the auspices of the project yet
The entire design and construction documentations have been completed by the project for three pilot buildings The documentations have been submitted to the State Construction Expertise for approval In these buildings according to their design the specific annual energy consumption for space heating and hot water supply will be less than 55 kWhm2
Since 2013 12 buildings apart from 3 project pilot buildings above are being designed using principles grounded and promoted by the project In these buildings the energy consumption for space heating already reduced to ca 30 kWhm2

description.narrative: 1. Status of the national laws and other regulatory documents controlling the energy consumption of the newly constructed buildings. 2. Demonstrated capacity of the Belarussian building sector specialist to integrate new EE approaches and measures into the design of the buildings and to implement them in practice. 3. Status of the demonstration projects. 4. Status of the planned public outreach activities. Status of the entity to follow up and continue the activities initiated by the project.

comment.narrative: 1. Prescriptive thermal standards adopted in 2010 defining minimum mandatory U-values for the building envelope, corresponding to the average annual heat demand of 60 kWh/m2 for space heating of typical multi-apartment buildings and 120-130 kWh /m2 together with sanitary hot water preparation. 2. Non-integrated design of the buildings just complying with the current prescriptive thermal standards in force. Lack of capacity of the public authorities to effectively supervise and enforce the implementation of the planned new, overall energy performance based norms and standards. 3. No demonstration projects implemented. 4. No public outreach activities implemented.

1. Strengthened legal and regulatory framework and mechanisms to enforce the legislation for improving the energy efficiency of the building sector with the focus on new residential buildings. 2. Enhanced capacity of the Belarusian specialists to implement and effectively enforce new energy efficient construction standards. 3. Demonstrated energy and cost-saving potential of new energy efficiency measures in three new residential buildings in three Belarusian cities. 4. Documented, disseminated and institutionalized project results providing a basis for further replication

1. Recomendations submitted to decision makers concerning the optimal heat supply and distribution options to serve low or close to zero energy buildings based on the analysis of cost-efficiency of technical options introduced into the energy efficient engineering systems of the pilot buildings and on the analysis of the impact these systems have on different kind of district heat supply. Based on the Technical Code Energy Efficiency of Buildings that indicates basic provisions for the certification system, the quality standards and a system of energy efficiency certification for the materials, equipment and component parts used in residential construction have been formally submitted for adoption. 2. At least 20 training and educational materials, tutorials and reference books published by the project in 2014-2017 have been accommodated in educational process and in curricula of at least two universities. At least 200 students have completed these new courses. At least 50 managers of the leading construction companies have been trained in the ways of integrating elements of energy efficient design in their investment projects. All instructional materials developed by the project in 2013-2017 have been transferred to a specialized training institutions. At least 2 Belarusian specialists and decision-makers participated in at least one international event dedicated to use of renewable energy, energy efficient installation and environmentally sustainable policies and practices in the field of construction and operation of buildings. 3. Energy efficiency performance of the buildings along with actual energy and cost saving data, and the emissions of greenhouse gases have been assessed and recorded in the monitoring reports. Set of different training materials has been developed and handed over to project stakeholders and target groups. In total (taking into account also year 2017) at least 30 visits to the pilot sites conjointly with training of half-day long have been organized and conducted in Minsk, Hrodna, Mahilioŭ for the local architects, designers, builders, building operators and decision makers. 4. At least 15 thematic publications have been provided for diffrenet key stakeholders and target groups. At least one informational campaign on promoting the entire experience of the project during its implementation concerning energy efficient housing has been launched and successfully completed. The methodology and provisions for organizational arrangements for the system of annual monitoring of construction of energy efficient residential buildings and the system for monitoring of production and sales of basic construction materials, equipment and appliances with the indication of energy efficiency performance values have been finalized, submitted into a conciliation procedure and adopted. The state agency that is responsible for National GHG Cadastre, has become fully capacitated in monitoring of energy saving and respective GHG emissions in the residential sector, and the procedure for the collection of necessary raw data, reporting and recording of these parameters has come under the responsibility of this company. Provisions of mechanisms for use of energy audit findings while developing the energy efficiency improvement strategies in housing and construction sectors have been proposed by the project and agreed by the interested parties. The Belarusian Institute of Urban and Regional Planning has integrated the issues of the construction of energy efficient residential buildings into the regional and local spatial development plans. International Conference “Best Practices in the Energy Efficiency Improvement in Residential Buildings” is organized and held annually, and a lager International Conference will be conducted by the end of the Project. At the end of the project, the projects website has been transferred to the UNDP website (http://www.by.undp.org/content/belarus/ru/home/library/environment_energy/) according to the decision of the UNDP Office. Some information from the projects website has been also transferred to the Energy Efficiency Departments website (http://energoeffekt.gov.by/). The report on the monitoring of the market of energy efficient buildings for 2013-2018 has been prepared and published on-line. Final reports containing the main technical results of the project as per each of its components along with lessons learned and recommendations for further replication of projects outcomes prepared and issued. The Terminal Evaluation Report on the final evaluation of the project prepared and published online.
